comment.author: 12410966@N07
comment._content: Supphellebreen in Sogn & Fjordane is the lowest-lying glacier of Norway.

comment.author: 34312291@N04
comment._content:
This glacier is now divided in two where the low part at the bottom of the valley is doomed to melt and disappear unless a major shift in glacial accumulation and transport from the top of the glacier is re-established.

While physical approach to the glacier itself is possible it is stricly recommended to keep proper distance as the glacier is constantly yielding ice rockets.

comment.author: 36657256@N00
comment._content: the figure adds the dimension to the image.
